==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2021/9/16/episode-597-september-14-2021 Episode #597: September 14, 2021]</ref>:

*Alex misreports the [https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/03/17/usps-ballot-fraud-investigation/ 2020 elections scandal] involving a PA postal worker
*Alex is mad about AOC's dress at the Met Gala, but likes Nicki Minaj's vaccine tweet, which the Health Minister of Trinidad [https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/16/americas/nicki-minaj-vaccine-story-false-scli-intl/index.html has said was not true]
*Alex misreports [https://www.reuters.com/world/us/heart-inflammation-after-covid-19-shots-higher-than-expected-study-us-military-2021-06-29/ a story about a military study] on heart inflammation after vaccination ([https://www.pennlive.com/nation-world/2021/06/rate-of-heart-inflammation-among-us-military-following-covid-19-shots-higher-than-expected-study-finds.html alternate link])
*Alex reports on [https://factcheck.afp.com/http%253A%252F%252Fdoc.afp.com%252F9MU3HH-1 a hoax Facebook meme] about Canadian Walmarts requiring proof of vaccination for people to shop in their stores
*Alex reports on [https://twitter.com/yinonw/status/1437439928326033411 a misleading graph] that he found on a random person's twitter account. The printout he's using to cover the story is just a tweet:

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1631852525639-VKBE1D9SXWLS9P4JV9X2/Mongolia.JPG|thumb|none]]

*Alex reports on [https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/550/text?r=6&s=1 a house resolution] introduced in January as if it is breaking news
